Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Grand Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres above two added white bands; exterior: Z band between pairs of lines; reserved below; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of filling ornament suggests that the sherd is later than those from the Mature Animal Style and the rim pattern is executed more carefully than those on Chalice Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.1.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0778) (phase 2)
